@Module.Name: Predict
@Module.Description: This module is a prediction model, predicting what will appear after clicking each components on current screen

@Module.Name: Select
@Module.Description: This module is a selection model, selecting the top 5 most possible component to be acted on catering to user's intent
@Module.Output:
<div id=1 class='' description='CalendarCan be expanded into a service widget'>: This component represents the Calendar widget. Tapping on it may open the calendar app or provide information about upcoming events and meetings, including the next meeting.
                <div id=2 class='' description='NotepadCan be expanded into a service widget'>: Although the description is empty for this component, it represents the Notepad widget. It's worth exploring as it could potentially contain notes or reminders about upcoming meetings.
                <div id=3 class='' description='ClockCan be expanded into a service widget'>: This component represents the Clock widget. Tapping on it may provide information about the current time and upcoming events, including the next meeting.
                <div id=7 class='' description='WeatherCan be expanded into a service widget'>: Similar to the Clock widget, the Weather widget may provide information about the current weather conditions and upcoming events, including the next meeting.
                <div id=6 class='' description='Settings'>: Although the description is empty for this component, it represents the Settings app. It's worth exploring as it could potentially contain settings related to calendars and meetings.
                So the top five most possible components to the user's intent are:
                {
                    "result": [1,2,3,7,6]
                }

@Module.Name: Plan
@Module.Description: This module is a plan module, planning the next action based on the selected components, whether click or edit
Input:
Calendar
Notepad

@Module.Name: Evaluate
@Module.Description: This module is an evaluation module, evaluating the selected components of their contribution to fulfilling the user's intent

@Module.Name: Decide
@Module.Description: This module is a decision module, deciding the final action based on the evaluation result, whether complete or wrong or go on

Output.reason: The user has opened the calendar which is the correct place to look for the next meeting, but the task is not completed as there is no information about when the next meeting is on the current UI screen.
